Articles.Content: I personally think it would be really cool if there was a mission or maybe just a set point in time that triggers a mission in which you use spacecraft to avert planetary apocalypse. Apocalypses could include asteroid collisions, the decay of a moons orbit, an incoming comet, a gamma ray burst, a solar flare... I could go on and on. This would also add the ability to deliberately destroy planets on purpose. I think that this would be a really cool feature.
We don't have the ship abilities to do any of this except asteroids and we already have redirect missions.
Except career is goofy, so if a planet killer was coming, the most effective solution would be to decline the contract, Kerbin saved!
XD It doesn't have to be mission it would be kinda like a wake up call for people who are too scared to go past Minmus like myself.

Yeah, no. KSP doesn't need to feature Armageddon or some other dime-a-dozen thriller plot, it already shouldn't feature itself.

A better way to get people out past Minmus would be to lengthen the tech tree and reduce science gains in Kerbin SOI. Alternatively, stop giving contracts for Kerbin SOI past the first two thirds of the tech tree.

I'd love to see how many mammoths you use to push a moon back into a stable orbit. I guess at least with a couple million drills you could keep them all fueled indefinitely.

But how would you even know a gamma ray burst were incoming, much less avert it?

This is a bit science fiction-ish, but sometimes we can predict unusual solar activity beforehand by observation of other conditions that historically precede it. As for averting it, some works suggest building a giant shield at Earth-Sun L1 (and a shelter at Earth Sun L2 in case it goes badly). Not particularly feasible in KSP (or likely reality), but an interesting thought.
